instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 -  stuck at 5v after the short
threads.message:
The board had oxidation and an ugly short on the C7685, it even made a hole in the board. I removed the component and the short is gone. In diode mode, the line is 0.200 and PPBus 1v.

C3215 LDO lines are normal, 0.500. But I don't have 1v on the ports.

Any tips?

threads.title: 820-01521 -  stuck at 5v after the short
threads.message:
"In diode mode, the line is 0.200"
Check the reverse reading (black on ground).
Post U7000 basic voltages; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, SMC_RST_IN, EN_MVR, CBC_ON, A/BMON.

threads.title: 820-01521 -  stuck at 5v after the short
threads.message:
While checking the voltages on the U7000 I found that the short has returned. I removed the C7685 again and found that the problem was the hole it made in the board. I isolated and soldered otherwise, now the board turned on again.

Thanks a lot for your attention and help!
